meanings.definition: Relating to an edict or edicts.
meanings.sent1: The king's edictal command was followed by all the villagers.
meanings.sent2: The edictal language used in the decree was clear and direct.
meanings.sent3: The edictal announcement made everyone in the kingdom laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her edictal tone reminded him of a strict teacher.
meanings.sent5: The edictal nature of the rule made it impossible to disobey.

meanings.definition: Issuing or relating to an official proclamation or decree.
meanings.sent1: The edictal document was signed by the highest authority.
meanings.sent2: The edictal order was sent out to all government officials.
meanings.sent3: The edictal announcement caused a stir in the court.
meanings.sent4: His edictal power was unquestioned by the people.
meanings.sent5: The edictal decree changed the course of history.
